text: Sattagydia (Old Persian: ğ°ğ«ğ¦ğ¢ğ ThataguÅ¡, country of the "hundred cows") was one of the easternmost places of the Achaemenid EmpireHerodotus III 91, III 94 along with GandÄrae, Dadicae and Aparytae. It was located east of the Sulaiman Mountains up to the Indus River in the basin around Bannu in modern day's southern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. == References == Category:Achaemenid satrapies
title: Sattagydia
